description: ## Overview Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Information Exposure due to the use of predictable TCP initial sequence numbers. An attacker can intercept or hijack a TCP session by predicting the sequence numbers used in the TCP connection establishment process. ## Remediation A fix was pushed into the `master` branch but not yet published. ## References - [Additional Information](https://blog.quarkslab.com/pixiefail-nine-vulnerabilities-in-tianocores-edk-ii-ipv6-network-stack.html) - [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2258703)
remediation: A fix was pushed into the master branch but not yet published.
title: Information Exposure

vulnDescription.Overview: Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Information Exposure due to the use of predictable TCP initial sequence numbers. An attacker can intercept or hijack a TCP session by predicting the sequence numbers used in the TCP connection establishment process.
